summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver 7.5.0 (ReDoS) found via nyc-test-coverage dependency chain. The issue was automatically resolved when the vulnerable library was removed from the inventory.
userImpact: Potential denial of service attack via malformed semantic version ranges if untrusted user data reaches the semver parser.
rootCause: Versions of semver before 7.5.2 contain a ReDoS vulnerability in the Range function when processing untrusted user input.
proposedFix: Upgrade semver dependency to version 7.5.2 or later.
resolutionDetails: Automatic closure by Mend when the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency tree or marked as ignored.
keyQuote: Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range
